skill.name: nx-workspace-patterns
skill.description: Configure and optimize Nx monorepo workspaces. Use when setting up Nx, configuring project boundaries, optimizing build caching, or implementing affected commands.
skill.summary: Configure and optimize Nx monorepo workspaces. Use when setting up Nx, configuring project boundarie...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: This skill contains static documentation and templates for Nx configuration. No executable code, data access, or network behavior is present.

content.value_statement: Nx workspaces can become slow and inconsistent without clear standards. This skill provides templates to set boundaries, caching, and affected workflows.
actual_capabilities: Provide nx.json template with cacheable operations and target defaults
Provide project.json template for web app build, serve, test, and lint
Provide ESLint module boundary rules using @nx/enforce-module-boundaries
Provide custom generator example for feature libraries
Provide GitHub Actions CI workflow using affected commands
Provide remote caching examples for Nx Cloud and S3
limitations: Does not run Nx commands or edit files
Does not validate existing workspace configuration
Examples require adaptation to your repo paths and tags
Does not create or manage cloud credentials

use_cases.title: Stand up a new workspace
use_cases.description: Apply recommended structure, tags, and caching defaults for a new Nx monorepo.

use_cases.title: Speed up build pipelines
use_cases.description: Use affected commands and caching patterns to reduce CI time.

use_cases.title: Enforce project boundaries
use_cases.description: Define module boundaries to keep features, UI, and data access separated.

prompt_templates.title: Starter nx.json
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a minimal nx.json with cacheable operations and target defaults for build, test, and lint.

prompt_templates.title: Project config
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a project.json for a React web app using @nx/webpack with build, serve, test, and lint targets.

prompt_templates.title: Boundary rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Create ESLint @nx/enforce-module-boundaries rules for app, feature, ui, data-access, and util libraries.

prompt_templates.title: CI affected flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a GitHub Actions workflow that installs dependencies and runs nx affected lint, test, build, and e2e.

output_examples.input: I need module boundaries for an Nx workspace.
output: Define tags for app, feature, ui, data-access, and util libraries
Allow app to depend on feature, ui, data-access, and util
Restrict feature to depend only on ui, data-access, and util

best_practices: Use consistent tags and enforce them with module boundaries
Enable caching and affected commands early in CI
Keep libraries focused and document their scope
anti_patterns: Running full test suites when affected would suffice
Creating many tiny libraries without clear purpose

faq.question: Is this compatible with current Nx versions?
faq.answer: Yes, the patterns target modern Nx workspaces with project.json configuration.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides templates and guidance only, not automated changes or validation.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing CI?
faq.answer: Yes, the workflow example fits most CI systems that can run nx commands.

faq.question: Does it access my data or secrets?
faq.answer: No, it does not read files, environment variables, or network resources.

faq.question: What should I check if Nx commands fail?
faq.answer: Verify Nx version, project.json paths, and cache settings for mismatches.

faq.question: How does this compare to official Nx docs?
faq.answer: It condenses common patterns into ready templates for faster setup.
